name: Car Sequencing – CR1
content: Add a new constraint to limit consecutive identical car types: no more than two cars of the same type may appear consecutively in the production sequence. The model must still satisfy all original car sequencing constraints, including per-option capacity limits and demand satisfaction.
value_info:
`at_most`: A list of integers specifying, for each option, the maximum number of cars that can require that option within any window of size `per_slots[o]`.
`per_slots`: A list of integers defining the window size for each option, used to check capacity constraints.
`demand`: A list of integers representing the number of cars required for each car type.
`requires`: A 2D binary list of shape `[n_types × n_options]`, where `requires[t][o] = 1` indicates that car type `t` requires option `o`.

var1.descr: `sequence`: A list of integers representing the order of car types in the assembly sequence. Each value corresponds to the type index of the car produced at that position.
